DataElement.preferredName: Elderly Total Physical Activity Assessment Description Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An age group comprised by people 65 years of age and older._Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition._Any form of exercise or movement. Physical activity may include planned activity such as walking, running, basketball, or other sports. Physical activity may also include other daily activities such as household chores, yard work, walking the dog, etc._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something._The words of something written.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An age group comprised by people 65 years of age and older.

Concepts.definition: An age group comprised of individuals 65 years of age and older.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete.:Any form of exercise or movement. Physical activity may include planned activity such as walking, running, basketball, or other sports. Physical activity may also include other daily activities such as household chores, yard work, walking the dog, etc. (from NIDDK Glossary; http://www.niddk.nih.gov/health/nutrit/pubs/glossary/glossaryintro.htm):Having determined the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.

Any form of exercise or movement. Physical activity may include planned activity such as walking, running, basketball, or other sports. Physical activity may also include other daily activities such as household chores, yard work, walking the dog, etc.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
